author: schone_wizard
content: Why isn‚Äôt having clients hit a URL under the Ethereum foundation‚Äôs domain for a dynamic TTD a default option? It pretty much contains the same trust assumptions as accepting a baked into the code TTD does and you still have the option to force an override

author: Deleted User
content: What if the domain gets hacked? Things like that happen. Not only because of EF's fault, but someone might social engineer the domain registrar.

author: sky.cactus
content: Baked into the code means that client devs define it, and each client dev *can* define it independently, and at time of update the user can verify/validate and it then cannot change out from under the user.

author: sky.cactus
content: There is a very big difference in trust between a one-time trust operation that can be validated through a trust network and an ongoing trust relationship that can be compromised at any time (which means you cannot validate it through your trust network without a similar continuous validation process).
